body.name: Apevia ATX-SN900 Signature 900W 80+ Bronze Certified Active PFC ATX Semi-Modular Gaming Power Supply
features: 900W 80+ Bronze Certified Active PFC ATX Gaming Semi-Modular Power Supply.

Modular Design Supports Cable Management. Connectors: 1 x 20/24pin Main Power, 1 x P8(4+4P) ESP 12V, 4 x SATA + 4 x 8(6+2)pin PCI-E, 4 x Peripheral, 1 x Floppy. Single 12V Output for Higher Power Usage.
Auto-Thermally Controlled 135mm Blue LED Fan. Output: +3.3V@20A, +5V@20A, +12V@66A, -12V@0.3A, +5Vsb@2.5A
Heavy Duty Protections: Short-Circuit/ Over-Voltage/ Over-Power/ Under-Voltage Protections. Double Forward Converter Design.
Supports ATX 12V 2.3 Version. Supports Dual/Quad Core CPUs. Supports SLI/Crossfire/ Haswell.
body.description: Apevia's Signature line of power supplies bring an elegant form and function to your system while still suiting your needs. It supports the newer ATX 12v2.3 standard and single rail setup. Boasting a cool blue 135mm LED fan, it adds a nice glow to any computer. The Signature line also uses a semi-modular cable setup, allowing you to use only the connectors that you need. No excessive tucking of wires required. Just put the unused plugs away for future use. It also uses Active PFC, with a 99% factor correction, boosting performance and saving energy. No toggle switch included, the power supply automatically switches between 110V and 240V depending on the power grid its attached to. 80+ Bronze certified. For safety, do not overload, abuse or modify the power supply unit. Use of this unit for Bitcoin Mining is not suggested since it will shorten the life and cause failures of power supply. Use for mining purposes is not covered by warranty.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.4 4.4 out of 5 stars 133 ratings 4.4 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Had everything I needed for a mid gaming pc and more. Really quiet and runs very cool. Update: After 3 weeks this PSU died with just normal use, no gaming yet. Returned and now waiting for the exchange to arrive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great PSU on a budget
reviews.reviewText: I juggled the option of buying my first Apevia PSU some months ago because there were reviews that depicted them as fire hazards, but after running three (now) for weeks at a time without issue, I believe many of the poor reviews on Apevia PSUs to be user error (and some freak occurrences.) I've been confident enough in the models I have to invalidate the warranties just to disconnect the LED lights (I wish manufacturers would add an on/off switch.) The fans run quietly, and the output is stable if you aren't overloading the supply.You DO need to keep in mind that there are only 2 PCI-E outputs (1 hard-wired, one modular.) Depending on your graphics card(s) you need to be mindful of how you connect the cables or you'll run the risk of melting wires. The chances of overloading other connectors is slim, unless you like extreme overclocking (in which case I would definitely NOT recommend using an Apevia PSU;) these are consumer level units, rather than enthusiast.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fabulious Customer service of this product team
reviews.reviewText: I get this product last Nov, and it stopped working last week.The important aspect need to know is the customer service of this product. As soon as I called the technical support team, and the gentlemen asked me couple question, verified it is the problem of power supply. He provide the instructions as how to get a new replacement.After I provided the invoice copy and the picture of the barcode of the product, I get the confirmation the replacement is shipped and I get the new one after two days.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: For my purposes, this was exactly what I needed. A bit of overkill on the Wattage, but all the cabling and support I need for my machine. And the price fit my budget as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I have the power
reviews.reviewText: Upgraded from 600 W to 900W, and this PSU did the trick. Comes with all the cables you need.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Wasn't bad for gaming.
reviews.reviewText: Lasted like 2 months then caught on fire.I went to SLI 2070s and I smelt something burning and then it shut off and smoked for a couple of minutes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: it is queit and stable good price

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Buen producto por ahora...ideal para la computadora gamer...excelente

reviews.reviewTitle: This fraud. Gives 500w maximum, despite the label.
reviews.reviewText: I bought 2 of them and my equipment begun crashing. Was looking for all kind of reasons, but all was fine. Finally it occurred to me to measure power output and sure enough - hardly 500W.I have returned both in the same box I have received them. Seller says that got only one. Thankfully it is easy to prove just by package weight and I am sure Amazon will figure it out, but the persistent desire to somehow defraud customers deserves attention
